amendment.description: To improve national security through the establishment of a Civilian Linguist Reserve Corps Pilot Project within the Department of Defense comprised of citizens fluent in foreign languages who would be available to provide translation services and related duties, as needed.

action.text: Amendment SA 1550, previously agreed to, was modified further by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Amendment SA 1550 as modified agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Amendment SA 1550 proposed by Senator Warner for Senator Feingold. (consideration: CR S12589-12595) To improve national security through the establishment of a Civilian Linguist Reserve Corps Pilot Project within the Department of Defense comprised of citizens fluent in foreign languages who would be available to provide translation services and related duties, as needed.
Senate amendment agreed to: Amendment SA 1550 as modified agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 1550 proposed by Senator Warner for Senator Feingold.
